intro: Cathartolinum schiedeanum, commonly known as the Schiedea's cathartolinum, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, showy bracts that resemble petals. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. It produces small, clustered flowers that are usually white or pale pink in color. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
